Comments_List: I learned the basic knowledge of neuroscience and formed a systematic framework of neuroscience. Also, I learned how great scientists made great discoveries.
basic membrane biophysics, basic overview of cortical systems
Basic survey of neuroscience. It was a typical class in terms the lecture format.

I learned the topics of vision, electrophysiology, nociception, motor learning, memory, and other important topics in neuroscience. Majority of the information was new to me so I gained a lot of insight.

The strengths: the instructors are experienced and we can discuss with them.

The weaknesses: the course is not so organized. Maybe next time it can be organized better.

A level of disorganization in the order in which the class is taught
Sometimes review material provided did not align with topics covered in class

Strengths: It was a basic survey of neuroscience, which was helpful.

Weaknesses: It was not tailored to the graduate students at all. I didn't find the seminar to be beneficial. The level of engagement from the other graduate students was reduced by the structure of the class, and the instructor input/questions filled most of the class time. It felt like the purpose of the presentation was to push the presenter to answer questions from the instructors rather than improving the understanding of other students in the course. 

It could be improved by going in more depth rather than breadth. The seminar section could be reorganized to be led by students to be more of a discussion about the other student's work rather than a presentation.

This course was very challenging. For each test, I studied two weeks in advance. I created study guides, flashcards, practice problems, read the book, studied in groups, and asked the instructors for help. Yet I still was not performing as well as I liked on the test. The way the course is designed is not intended for first year graduate students who were not Neuroscience undergraduates. I was learning a lot of the information for the first time so the class was very demanding.
Yes, for beginners in neuroscience, it is a good course to learn the basic knowledge and form a systematic framework of it.
Yes, provides good foundation in neurobiology
Not particularly. The basic survey was useful, but could be improved. The seminar was not engaging.

No. This course was not designed appropriately for graduate students. I also wish I received more specific feedback so I could improve my performance. I felt I was giving my best effort but my grades were not showing that.
